text: Joel and I met with the regional Nordic rep yesterday. He turned us on to this: <http://www.nordicsemi.com/eng/News/News-releases/Product-Related-News/Nordic-Semiconductor-IPv6-over-Bluetooth-Smart-protocol-stack-for-nRF51-Series-SoCs-enables-small-low-cost-ultra-low-power-Internet-of-Things-applications>

attachments.text: Now available for download, the nRF51 IoT Software Development Kit (SDK) is a complete IPv6-ready Internet Protocol Suite for Nordic's market-leading nRF51 Series Bluetooth Smart SoCs. The SDK enables native and interoperable IP-based connectivity between a Bluetooth Smart 'thing' and a cloud service. It also enables Bluetooth Smart to be used in large, distributed, cloud-connected, heterogeneous networks such as home, industrial, and enterprise automation
attachments.fallback: Now available for download, the nRF51 IoT Software Development Kit (SDK) is a complete IPv6-ready Internet Protocol Suite for Nordic's market-leading nRF51 Series Bluetooth Smart SoCs. The SDK enables native and interoperable IP-based connectivity between a Bluetooth Smart 'thing' and a cloud service. It also enables Bluetooth Smart to be used in large, distributed, cloud-connected, heterogeneous networks such as home, industrial, and enterprise automation

text: chatty protocol + TCP? What could go wrong?
